Tweet: Women's day is not just a day, black history month is not just a month and so on, but rather are reminders that we always gotta be working to chip away at and dismantle systemic and institutionalized inequity.

So it's important, especially those of us with power and privilege, to be constantly and consistently aware of history, of the present, and the complicity of those two things and how they inform power and privilege.

At moments like this, like #WomensDay2018 , it's important to remember that progress and revolution are not linear. Progress and revolution must be active and ongoing. History operates in a spiral, as the times we're living in demonstrate

I hope this didn't come off whitesplainey, I just thought that the movie brought a lot to anti-colonial and anti-racist discourses through how it showcases black excellence and Ryan Coogler fuckin killed it.

Does anyone in THIS universe have access to vibranium? No (that we know of lol), but the argument can be extended to other natural resources and how societies could have developed in their own unique, important and valid way.
had it not been for colonization, and the ongoing fallout of colonization and had those peoples been allowed to retain control of the resources they had access to.

knew and know EXACTLY what the fuck they are doing in putting vibranium to use, arguments around their foreign policy aside. This is how peoples in Africa and the rest of the Formerly Colonized World could have existed

So the movie directly and fundamentally refutes and debunks the colonial thesis by showing the Wakandans, an African civilizarion (with unique groups within) living atop a large vibranium deposit for thousands of years
But, like I said before, Wakanda is, on the whole, lightyears ahead of the rest of the world technologically
but they're sitting on all these valuable resources, but because they are not us they don't understand how to use them like we do, we must take it.'
Which therein lies the key point. The whole logic of colonialism was/is 'we're European and white and civilized, they in Africa are not European and not white and thus not civilized,

So, like vibranium is a highly sought after resource in the Marvel universe, in addition to being pretty rare. It's pretty indestructible, light weight and malleable, as well as all the other ways Wakanda put it to use for their own tech
I think that the vibranium in Black Panther is just as important as Erik to the anti-colonial theme of the film (dw there's no spoilers here), which like we know why he's so important
Yo honestly #BlackPanther best pick up some hardware next year because like this is a joke

I haven't used this in a while, but like #TheOscars needs to do better. Get Out was an actually socially relevant film; even Lady Bird had some important themes. It's a racist, sexist, classier, circle jerk. I'm too drunk for this #oscarssowhite #oscarssomale
